alert.note: Alert for Osage (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 5:42PM CDT until August 02 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...THE FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL OSAGE COUNTY... At 540 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain have weakened and moved out of the warned area. Up to three inches of rain has already fallen with no additional rain expected at this time. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that will experience flooding include... Linn, Rich Fountain and Loose Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland, and other low lying spots.
